name: Cuban Slider
description: This medium-sized turtle has relatively subdued coloration—a dark brown to olive carapace, light plastron, and a gray head with yellow longitudinal stripes.
proportions: Carapace length up to 39 cm; weight up to 11 kg
reproduction: Females lay 6–18 eggs; incubation lasts about 60–80 days.
attractions: It forages in water but enjoys basking on the shore or on protruding logs. With excellent vision and high alertness, it swiftly slides back into the water at the slightest sign of danger.
breeding: Prague Zoo has kept Cuban sliders since 2004, successfully breeding them since 2007, with nearly fifty offspring hatched so far.
